intro: Oreocnide rufescens, commonly known as the red-hued oreocnide, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Oreocnide rufescens typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of understory vegetation.
